p: THC is a CB 1 partial agonist, known to promote systemic vasodilation in addition to negative inotropy. [ 4] CBD, however, has little affinity for CB 1 or CB 2. Instead, acting as a CB 1 inverse agonist indirectly via GPCRs. CBD also acts on noncannabinoid targets, that is, as a GPR-55 antagonist and 5-HT 1A agonist. CB 1 blockade is a proposed druggable target in cardiomyopathies because inhibition reverses negative inotropy. [ 4] We hypothesize that the high CBD content in the patient's cannabis oil, in conjunction with his standard cardiac care, to be responsible for his improved functional capacity.
